div.p: It's A Great Day To be A Wolverine!

h3.strong: FCCLA organizes Food drive until May 4

div.class: sqs-block image-block sqs-block-image sqs-col-5 span-5 float float-left
image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: Wadena-Deer Creek FCCLA members are being encouraged from the state level to participate in an "Each One Reach One Campaign." Wadena-Deer Creek FCCLA members Emma Mehl and Morgan Grangruth came up with the suggestion to collect food for the Wadena Food Shelf.
The public is encouraged to drop off non-perishable items in a collection tub in the WDC Middle/High School main entry until May 4. Thank you! #EachOneReachOne

h1.strong: WDC house accepting bids until may 18

div.class:
sqs-gallery-container sqs-gallery-block-slideshow
sqs-gallery-has-controls sqs-gallery-has-thumbnails
sqs-gallery-block-show-meta sqs-gallery-block-meta-position-bottom
sqs-gallery-block-show-meta
sqs-gallery-transparent-background block-animation-none clear
sqs-block image-block sqs-block-image sqs-col-7 span-7 float float-right
image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

img.alt: The house (pictured) is located on Community Center Drive behind the high school, next to tennis courts.
The house (pictured) is located on Community Center Drive behind the high school, next to tennis courts.

div.p: The house (pictured) is located on Community Center Drive behind the high school, next to tennis courts.

Wadena-Deer Creek School District is accepting bids for their 28-by-40-foot (1,120 square feet), 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom house built by the WDC construction class. Deadline to submit a sealed bid is May 18.

The house features vaulted ceilings in the living room//kitchen and entry way, as well as a master bathroom with adjoining bathroom and walk-in closet! These are just a few of the high-quality amenities this house offers.
The minimum bid is $55,500. Sealed bids will be accepted until 2 p.m., May 18 at the WDC District Office.
Appointments to view the house or to inquire about construction details, contact construction teacher Mike Shrode, at (320) 815-7886.
To download a BID PACKET, click on this BID PACKET link or copies available in the District Office at 600 Colfax Ave SW.

div.class: sqs-block image-block sqs-block-image sqs-col-6 span-6 float float-left
image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: If your child is having problems with their iPad or any other technology issues, please call our school offices for help first — elementary office 632-2400 or middle/high school office at 632-2300.
We’d rather you call to see if we can troubleshoot the problem before coming into the office.
We are trying our best to practice social distancing and keeping our families at home. Thank you for your cooperation!
#StayAtHome #StaySafe #SocialDistancing

div.class: sqs-block image-block sqs-block-image sqs-col-3 span-3 float float-right
image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: As Wadena-Deer Creek School District moves forward with its distance learning curriculum, meal delivery and child care, Supt. Westrum has drafted a plan.

We want to thank to our families for your support and cooperation as we begin our distance-learning curriculum on Monday. Teachers will be ready to work with students and their expectations as we move forward over the next month.
To review the plan, please click below:

a.strong: Click here for the WDC Distance Learning Plan

div.class: sqs-block image-block sqs-block-image sqs-col-3 span-3 float float-left
image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: WDC is currently providing childcare, as directed by Gov. Walz, to families who qualify as Tier 1 emergency/health care workers. In addition, we are providing childcare for educators who are required to report to work to develop distance-learning curriculum for our PreK-12 students and to provide other required services. Unfortunately, we cannot provide any additional childcare for Tier 2 workers due to staffing limitations and health guidelines regarding grouping and social distancing. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation!

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none
